description: I returned to Charles Schwab after my internship. Since then, I have led the effort of updating their servers for four different applications. I have also created new API endpoints for two different applications in the company's Retirement Business Services. As part of their new employeee program, I have earned certifications for Google Cloud Certified Associate Cloud Engineer and Professional Scrum Master. I work remote in the Orlando area.

I accepted an internship with Charles Schwab in October 2021, having already been a client of the business already. As an intern, I worked with Java and Spring to create two new endpoints for fetching prices of assets. I automated testing of a webpage using Cucumber for Java and Gherkin, cutting time from QA review. Throughout my time, I explored the Scrum process, SQL, Continuous Integration/Development, and Splunk. I worked in their corporate Phoenix office

I was asked by Professor Sean Szumlanski to jonin his TA Team after completing the core data structures and algorithms courses. I advised roughly 20 students per month per month during office hours. I answered questions on the programming assignnments, lectures, and the notes, both for C and Java languages. Overall, I evaluated 200 students in four sections of the courses, grading 200 programming assignments and 100 exams per semester.

During the spring semester, I joined the executive board of the university's largest Computer Science-focused student organization as the Treasurer. Beforehand, I served as part of the Sponsorship Team, securing donations from companies such as Microsoft, Google Cloud, EA Sports, and ManTech for our hackathon. I managed the organization's $10,000 budget and finances. With the executive board, I coordinated club logistics by scheduling over 20 events, hiring directors, answering member questions, and ordering merchandise.

As an RA, I guided freshman residents living on campus by establishing connections, leading them to resources, and assisting them by answering their questions. Each semester, I managed a floor of over 50 residents. I decorated the floor and updated the walls with posters of clubs and upcoming events. I was also tasked with creating a safe enviornment for students which is why I was trained for crisis response.
